p: The advantage of a case reporting system is that there is an organized system of reporting and tabulating cases at both the local and national level. Also, at the local level, individuals are identified for intervention. However, case-reporting systems also have a number of disadvantages, including the following: (1) not all cases are reported despite legal requirements, primarily because of the lack of both symptoms and resources; (2) the variability in reporting from one jurisdiction to another; and (3) the lack of hepatitis C laboratory tests that distinguish between acute and chronic HCV infection.
